['Off-the-rack', 'Pre-owned', 'Ready-to-wear', 'Ready made', 'Factory finished', 'Made-to-measure', 'Mass produced', 'Secondhand', 'Not bespo Written by: Linda Ragland, PhD', 'While many people are aware of how important it is to exercise for their physical health, they may not realize just how beneficial exercise can be for their mental health as well', 'In fact, research has shown that physical activity and exercise may have similar effects on the brain as some antidepressant medications do.', 'Exercise increases endorphins – One of the most well-known benefits of exercise for our overall health and fitness comes from its ability to help us maintain a healthy weight', 'Exercise reduces inflammation – Depression is linked to high levels of inflammation in the body', 'Exercited increases your self-esteem – When you engage in regular exercise or set a goal to reach for something (e.g., running 5K), it is an opportunity to prove to yourself that you can achieve difficult tasks', 'Exercise helps sleep better – Poor sleep quality has been linked with a host of mental health conditions like anxiety disorders, bipolar disorder, major depressive disorder (MDD), post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and others', 'Exercise improves concentration and memory – Aerobic exercise has been shown to improve cognitive functioning, including improved attention span and better working memory (short-term memory)', 'Exercise improves self-control – Chronic stress can impact our ability to control impulsive behavior and make good decisions when we’re under pressure or faced with challenges', 'So why not start today? Whether you choose to take up jogging, join a sports team or simply go for walks around the neighborhood with friends, adding some physical activity into your daily routine is an easy way to reap the mental health benefits of regular exercise']
